name: SliceShow

aliases.name: SliceShow
aliases.comment: SliceShow app, exposes html signal and tasks signal
aliases.type: { html : Signal.Signal Html.Html , tasks : Signal.Signal (Task.Task Effects.Never ()) }

values.name: init
values.comment: Init Model from the list of slides

values.name: setDimensions
values.comment: Set initial dimensions taken from port
values.type: ( Int, Int ) -> SliceShow.Config a b -> SliceShow.Config a b

values.name: setHash
values.comment: Set initial hash taken from port
values.type: String -> SliceShow.Config a b -> SliceShow.Config a b

values.name: setInputs
values.comment: Set inputs for the custom content
values.type: List (Signal.Signal b) -> SliceShow.Config a b -> SliceShow.Config a b

values.name: setUpdate
values.comment: Set update for the custom content
values.type: (b -> a -> ( a, Effects.Effects b )) -> SliceShow.Config a b -> SliceShow.Config a b

values.name: setView
values.comment: Set view for the custom content
values.type: (Signal.Address b -> a -> Html.Html) -> SliceShow.Config a b -> SliceShow.Config a b

values.name: show
values.comment:
Start the SliceShow with your `slides`:
    app = show (init slides)
    main = app.html
    port tasks : Signal (Task.Task Never ())
    port tasks = app.tasks

name: SliceShow.Slide
comment:
This module helps you define a slide
@docs Slide, slide

values.name: slide
values.comment: Create new slide from a list of content items

name: SliceShow.Content
comment:
This module helps you define Slide content
@docs Content, item, container, custom, hide

values.name: container
values.type: (List Html.Html -> Html.Html) -> List (SliceShow.Content.Content a) -> SliceShow.Content.Content a
